messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] RE: Some art inspired by the awesome Samurai.
messages.msgSnippet: Excellent work! If you re at all interested, contact me off-list -- I MIGHT have a market to suggest to you. Kiotsukete ne! --R. Michael Burns ... From: C Mark
messages.messageBody:
Excellent work!  

If you're at all interested, contact me off-list -- I MIGHT have a market to suggest to you.

Kiotsukete ne!

--R. Michael Burns

-----Original Message-----
From: C Mark Clarke <gwilo@...>
To: samuraihistory <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tue, Dec 24, 2013 3:00 pm
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] RE: Some art inspired by the awesome Samurai.

 
mahalo!


On Saturday, December 21, 2013 8:32 PM, Gerritt Gatewood <glgwood@...> wrote:
 
I never did that at all
On Oct 2, 2013 8:03 PM, <dennis.mishler@...> wrote:
 
Very nice art work, Gerritt!

How did you make them and how long did they take?  One or two look like they may have been water color or something similar (says the non artist).

-Zen Blade


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, <glgwood@...> wrote:

Thank you
On Sep 22, 2013 5:02 PM, "tachiyana" <tanyatako@...> wrote:
 
I'd like to share some of my art, inspired by the awesome Samurai. My
deviantart nickname is Duhvoina <http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/> . For
example: Samurai Spirits
<http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/art/Samurai-Spirits-394213790> , Way of
Ascension
<http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/art/Way-of-Ascension-317784502> ,
Takeda Shingen
<http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/art/Takeda-Shingen-390776397> , Like
Sakura Petals
<http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/art/Like-sakura-petals-317780007> , Zen
and the Sword
<http://duhvoina.deviantart.com/art/Zen-and-the-Sword-are-One-317781921>
Hope you enjoy!Thank you.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] RE: Some art inspired by the awesome Samurai.
messages.msgSnippet: I would say water colour and acrylic, says the artist but not THE artist. Very cool work. I liked the bold colours to go with the warrior, both physical and
messages.messageBody:
I would say water colour and acrylic, says the artist but not THE artist. Very cool work. I liked the bold colours to go with the warrior, both physical and spiritual, themes. 

Sent from my iPhone

On Dec 24, 2013, at 2:32 PM, C Mark Clarke <gwilo@...> wrote:

 

mahalo!


On Saturday, December 21, 2013 8:32 PM, Gerritt Gatewood <glgwood@...> wrote:
 
I never did that at all

Very nice art work, Gerritt!

How did you make them and how long did they take?  One or two look like they may have been water color or something similar (says the non artist).

-Zen Blade
